results.title: The Progressive era: reform works in America
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Maurice Schonfeld
results.brief_description: Evaluates the aims and achievements of the group of American reformers known as the progressives. Depicts social and economic conditions that prevailed during the progressive era, 1890-1919. Describes the election of 1912, when all three presidential candidates ran as progressives.

results.title: The Professor's new clothes
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, ABC-TV (Australia), Channel 4, Janet Bell and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: ABC “Science Show” host, Robyn Williams, narrates this fascinating program on the ethics of scientific research and a recent case of major fraud involving internationally renowned geologist, Professor V. J. Gupta, of Punjab University. Gupta’s falsification of research spread over a 25 year period in 400 published papers. The fraud was unearthed due to the tireless detective work of Australian paleobiologist, Professor John Talent, of Macquarie University. The scandal generated by his findings resonated at a national level with the Indian government imposing a media ban in a cover-up attempt, but Talent’s perseverance meant the truth was finally made public.

results.title: The Professional = Leon
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Les Films du Dauphin, Claude Besson and Luc Besson
results.brief_description:
This hard-hitting, action packed thriller from acclaimed director Luc Besson, is filmed with sharp execution and cunning force, and delivers exceptional drama right from the start. Gary Oldman plays a drug-dealing Drug enforcement Agency officer whose maniacal greed leads to murder on the streets of New York. A deadly game of cat and mouse ensues when he crosses paths with a lone hitman named Leon (masterfully played by Jean Reno). Caught in the middle is an orphaned 12-year-old girl, who can’t forget or forgive the man who killed her family.
Cast also includes: Natalie Portman, Danny Aiello

results.title: The Production manager
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts, Gary Messenger and Bruce Seth Greer
results.brief_description: Outlines the role of the production manager in the making of a motion picture. Production Manager, Bud Brill, is seem at work - the strain, frustration and triumph are all here for the viewer to experience.

results.title: The Producers
results.creator_credit: Springtime, Crossbow, Sidney Glazier and Mel Brooks
results.brief_description: Considered one of Mel Brook’s funniest films, this hilarious farce follows an attempted swindle by a con artist (Zero Mostel) and his accountant (Gene Wilder) who attempt to stage a Broadway flop only to have it backfire. This film has achieved cult status and is known for musical interlude “Springtime for Hitler”. Wilder received an Oscar nomination for his role in this zany classic. The phony play was later actually produced by Alan Johnson.

results.title: The Problem with men
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Denise Eriksen and Bruce Permezel
results.brief_description: Presented by Bryan Dawe and John Clarke, this 4 part series looks at the area of men’s health - self examination, prevention of major illness such as heart disease and cancer, changing attitudes and bringing delicate areas specific to men’s health, into the limelight.

results.title: The Problem of refuse disposal
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into one of modern society’s urgent problems: how to dispose of the ever-increasing quantities of refuse that we produce everyday. Shows collection and various methods of disposal, including tipping, pulverising, composting with the addition of sewage sludge, or incineration, in a number of countries, such as Britain, France, German and Switzerland.

results.title: The Problem is life
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Ben Park and Peter Hollander
results.brief_description: With help from the UN, India has started a cast birth control programme. Focuses on a village where free contraceptive information is supplied, and films a vasectomy, which so far has proven the most successful method of contraception in India.

results.title: The Prize
results.brief_description: Snowy, a six-year-old boy wins a goat at a country show, and takes it home to show his friend, Lisa. However, the goat is lost andn suspicion falls on two boys, Dan and Marcus. There is a chase down-river in sawn-off barrels, a fight in the water and a lucky escape when the river reaches a waterfall.
